title: 114_s1700
content: The "Mitigation Facilitation Act of 2015" may be cited as the short title. It establishes a Mitigation Loan and Loan Guarantee Program. The "Mitigation Facilitation Act of 2015" establishes a program for eligible public entities to access mitigation loans and loan guarantees. Eligible entities include political subdivisions, regional governance entities, special purpose entities, and joint powers authorities certified by the Governor. The "Mitigation Facilitation Act of 2015" establishes a program for eligible public entities to access loans and loan guarantees from the Secretary of the Army for mitigation projects required under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. The "Mitigation Facilitation Act of 2015" sets up a program for eligible public entities to apply for loans and loan guarantees from the Secretary for mitigation projects under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. Eligible entities must submit an application with required information, and the Secretary will approve within 120 days. The Secretary will approve or disapprove an application from an eligible public entity for a loan or loan guarantee based on factors like compliance with financial plans and repayment ability. The Secretary will establish and administer loans or loan guarantees for eligible public entities approved based on factors like compliance with financial plans and repayment ability. The Secretary is authorized to provide loans or loan guarantees to eligible public entities. Appropriations are authorized as necessary, and the authority under this section will terminate 10 years after the enactment of the Act.
